sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"誓言"之意。
means: oath ： 指对上帝或神发出的庄严、正式的誓言以示自己话语的真实性。现多用于法庭上。
pledge ： 普通用词，指保证去做或不做某事的郑重许诺。
vow ： 指庄严的许诺或誓约。

sentence.Network_en: I had to admire David's vow that he would leave the programme.
sentence.Network_cn: 戴维发誓要离开这个项目，我不得不对他表示钦佩。

sentence.Network_en: While many models vow to go back to college, few do.
sentence.Network_cn: 很多模特发誓要重回大学校园，但很少有人做到。

sentence.Network_en: I made a silent vow to be more careful in the future.
sentence.Network_cn: 我暗暗发誓，日后要倍加小心。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French vou, from Latin votum (see vote); the verb from Old French vouer

entry.def: If you vow to do something, you make a serious promise or decision that you will do it.

example.ex: While many models vow to go back to college, few do...
example.tran: 很多模特发誓要重回大学校园，但很少有人做到。

example.ex: I solemnly vowed that someday I would return to live in Europe...
example.tran: 我郑重发誓，总有一天我将回到欧洲生活。

entry.def: A vow is a serious promise or decision to do a particular thing.

example.ex: I made a silent vow to be more careful in the future...
example.tran: 我暗暗发誓，日后要倍加小心。

example.ex: I had to admire David's  vow that he would leave the programme.
example.tran: 戴维发誓要离开这个项目，我不得不对他表示钦佩。

entry.def: Vows are a particular set of serious promises, such as the promises two people make when they are getting married.

example.ex: I took my marriage vows and kept them.
example.tran: 我结婚时许下誓言，并一直信守。

example.ex: ...a nun who had taken final vows...

means.word_mean: 1. a solemn pledge (to oneself or to another or to a deity) to do something or to behave in a certain manner;

sentences.sentence: "He vowed never to drink alcohol again"

means.word_mean: 2. dedicate to a deity by a vow

auth_sentence.content: He takes his vow of poverty very seriously.
auth_sentence.res_content: He takes his vow of poverty very seriously.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He takes his vow of poverty very seriously.

stems_affixes.word_buile: vow忠于,发誓→n.誓约 v.宣誓, 立誓, 发誓

stems_affixes.value_cn: 宣誓, 立誓, 发誓
stems_affixes.word_buile: vow忠于,发誓→n.誓约 v.宣誓, 立誓, 发誓

sentences.en: She took a vow never to lend money to anyone again.
sentences.cn: 她发誓绝不再借钱给别人。

sentences.en: My parents are under a vow to go to church every Sunday.
sentences.cn: 我父母许愿,每星期日都去做礼拜。

sentences.en: I vowed to do more of the cooking myself.
sentences.cn: 我发誓自己要多动手做饭。

sentences.en: She vowed that she would take the matter to court.
sentences.cn: 她郑重宣布要把这事诉诸法律。
